txt.en: As the banquet continued long into the night of Midsummer's Day, you spoke to each member of the Fellowship of the Ring as well as Faramir, Prince of Ithilien and Steward of Gondor. The Fellowship as it was may be no more, but the bonds that grew between its members and their truest friends remain firm and unbroken by time or distance. Indeed, it is quite a fitting end to Midsummer.

With the One Ring destroyed and the Enemy undone, the surviving members of the Fellowship of the Ring and their dear friends have gathered in Merethrond for a grand banquet to commemorate the wedding of King Aragorn II Elessar to Queen Arwen Undómiel.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: You must have the repeatable quest 'A Long-awaited Banquet, A Celebration Without End' underway to advance this Deed.</rgb>
Complete Midsummer quests in Minas Tirith and across Middle-earth
Complete 'A Long-awaited Banquet -- Frodo Baggins'
A Feast of Fellowship

With the One Ring destroyed and the Enemy undone, the surviving members of the Fellowship of the Ring and their dear friends have gathered in Merethrond for a banquet to commemorate the wedding of King Aragorn II Elessar to Queen Arwen Undómiel.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: You must have the repeatable quest 'A Long-awaited Banquet, A Celebration Without End' underway to advance this Deed.</rgb>
